# PATHFINDER-CLASS EXPEDITION SHUTTLE
[color=#a4885c]Ship Size:[/color] Medium
[color=#a4885c]Recommended Crew:[/color] 2-4
[color=#a4885c]Power Gen Type:[/color] AME
[color=#a4885c]Expeditions:[/color] Yes
[color=#a4885c]IFF Console:[/color] None
"Once a scout ship serving with the Nanotrasen Marine Expeditionary Forces, this now decommissioned and refurbished expedition-capable ship can be yours!"
# Tips on running KC Pathfinder shuttles - Optimal [bold]Target Power[/bold] (kW) for the generator unit is [color=#a4885c]27 [bold]kW[/bold][/color]. If you've added additional machines, check shuttle [bold]APC units[/bold] to monitor the shuttle's power draw and adjust the generator's [bold]Target Power[/bold] accordingly. For more general information on the power grid and other life support systems, refer to the [textlink="Power" link="Power"] guidebook article and the [textlink="Preflight Checklist" link="PreflightChecklist"/]. - There are two buttons in the cockpit: the one with a yellow and black frame controls the window shutters, toggling all shutters throughout the shuttle except for those in the dorms and over the exterior airlocks by the docks. The button with the gray frame controls the thrusters.
- For the basics of [bold]shuttle piloting[/bold], refer to [textlink="Piloting" link="Piloting"] and [textlink="Sector Topology" link="SectorTopology"/]. - For the basics of [bold]cargo hauling[/bold], refer to [textlink="Cargo Hauling" link="CargoHauling"]. - For the basics of [bold]expedition diving[/bold], refer to [textlink="Expeditions" link="Expeditions"]. - As a Captain of a Nanotrasen vessel, you have the authority to hire, fire, demote, or promote crew members at will, refer to [textlink="Hiring" link="Hiring"] for more information.
